name: Premier Inn Maidstone - A26/ Wateringbury

reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on location and were only looking for something functional and cost effective and I am pleased to say that is exactly what we found. What you see is what you get and the hotel delivered - simple double room, clean bathroom, restauant and bar attached. In addition I have to compliment the staff's courtesy throughout which was exemplery both day and night from every member.
reviews.title: WYSIWYG with courtesy

reviews.text: Good TV channel choice and 24hour wifi at only GBP3.00 per day. Only minor grumble is that when I extended my stay I couldn't have the same room rate as I had booked alerady on the internet.
reviews.title: Needs ALOT of work.

reviews.text: We have recently stayed at this hotel and felt like we had gone back in time. Stayed at various hotels before including premier inn and none have been as run down as this one.
reviews.title: Needs refurbishment

reviews.text: First the good points, the room was very clean, in fact spotless so congratulations to the cleaners. They are basically this hotels only good points.
reviews.title: Average Premier Inn, good Restaurant next door

reviews.text: The bad points the room was run down and in need of a refurbishment. Granted the bed was nice and big and comfy but the plug in the sink was broken, the sink didnt drain, the shower had no power at all. Like others have said, the caulking etc was terrible and panels didnt fit properly.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful area, hotel easy to find. Very friendly staff in the hotel and attached pub. Meals very good. Complaints would be pretty trivial and were remedied immeditaely by the staff, such as not enough towels or pillows. Other than that everything was excellent
reviews.title: clean, friendly, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't have any problems with this hotel It was clean, the room was bright and the bed was very comfortable. We received 2 text messages and a phonecall before we arrived confirming the reservation and asking if we needed anything for the room, which I was very impressed with as I've never had that with a Premier Inn before. At £66 for one night though, I felt this was not quite such the budget price that is always advertised.
reviews.title: Not so cheap but chearful

reviews.text: great rooms great value but get there before the late night staff gets on .......hes as awkward as they come last thing you need at 11pm and 4 tired kids dont let that put you off its a great hotel for the money very clean the bathroom was graet with a good hot shower 10 minutes from the motorway and a petrol garage right next door.
reviews.title: steve preston

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst attending a nearby family wedding and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We needed 2 rooms, 1 for my mother-in-law who was recovering from a recent replacement hip operation.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted by John, who ensured we had everything we needed for her in her room - he was fantastic (Premier Inn, you have a gem there!) Her room was set up for a disabled visitor, it was brilliant - a lower bed, a massive bathroom, emergency pull cords, dressing area; John also arranged for her to have a vibrating smoke alarm for under her pillow as she is deaf - nothing was too much trouble. Our room was just along the corridor, basically next door, and again totally up to Premier Inn standards - king size bed, beautiful bed linen, sparkling clean bathroom. I was really pleased to see we had wide floor length windows and that the top half opened, (as I'd stayed at the Woking Premier Inn earlier in the week and the room had been overbearingly hot and stuffy), and a large fan as it had forecast the hottest weekend of the year! Even though we faced the road and had both windows open as far as we could we didn't feel the road noise was excessive, but then again we had the fan on continuously as well so perhaps this acted as 'white noise'.
reviews.title: This Premier Inn lived up to Lenny Henry's advert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night after returning from Gatwick and dropping a relative off. The hotel was easy to find and in an attractive location. The receptionist was very cheerful and helpful. Our room at the rear of the hotel was large, clean, comfortable, and quiet, with adequate storage facility and a huge comfortable bed with additional pillows provided!!
reviews.title: Good overall experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tea/coffee and milk are provided in the room and there is a hairdryer attached next to the dressing table. The digital tv had plenty of channels for us.
reviews.title: OLD and tired.

reviews.text: The attached pub/restaurant has a varied menu at reasonable prices and service was quick with pleasant staff, and the food was good (we did not have breakfast).
reviews.title: Another good value stay

reviews.text: The bathroom was quite spacious with a full size bath and shower over, but we found the shower difficult to control and water pressure seemed low! Hair/ body wash dispensers are provided at the shower and sink.
reviews.title: Nice staff but hotel needs an update

reviews.text: Our only complaint was the rear of the toilet had stains down possibly from a leak and hadn't been cleaned properly (reported at hotel).
reviews.title: BELOW USUAL PREMIER INN STANDARD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff excellent, especially receptionist in the afternoon. Room was clean and adequate although a bit cramped. Mattress was hard hard for me but my wife liked it. Would have appreciated an easyc chair.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: Excellent value and great location.
reviews.title: VERY comfortable, reasonably priced, WONDERFUL staff
Great Food
reviews.text: Hats off to Premier Inn for understanding what travelers really need--great bed, hot shower, good TV and a staff who will help you with any special need. Two retired couples stayed here as basecamp for seeing Kent. We were very "needy." Being from Mississippi, we got cold--staff gave us perfect little space heaters. We needed to plan our touring around the weather at the sites--staff used their computers to help us plan around the rain. We found it difficult to find some sites--they simplied our instructions. ALSO, Premier Inn has wisely attached a wonderful CHEF AND BREWER PUB to this hotel. (By all means take Bed and Breakfast rate--it includes continental and custom hot breakfast). We ate at the Pub for SUPPER every day, too. Wonderful food and the chefs and wait staff even accommodated special dietary needs for me.
The restaurant adjacent to the Premier Inn has really raised it's game since the revamp last year.
reviews.title: Sleep elsewhere

reviews.text: Last night we enjoyed superb fillet steaks with a mushroom and peppercorn sauce, celeriac chips and wilted Swiss chard, all cooked to perfection, served with efficiency and pleasantness by Shauna.
reviews.title: Great hotel, faulty showers

description: Premier Inn at Wateringbury is a 40 bedroom hotel with a Chef and Brewer adjacent. We are located in a village setting away from the hustle and bustle of the town centre but still only a 5 minute drive to the town. We offer an exclusive Good Night Guarantee, if you are not happy with your stay we do not expect you to pay.Our prices start from £51 per room per night.
